snippet: The trade gap narrowed 7.4 percent to $41.9 billion, the lowest level since February. Initial claims for unemployment benefits rose 12,000 to 282,000.
abstract: Commerce Department says trade deficit fell 7.4 percent in July to $41.9 billion, smallest level since February; Labor Department reports claims for unemployment benefits rose 12,000 to seasonally adjusted 282,000 in latest week.
lead_paragraph: The trade gap narrowed 7.4 percent to $41.9 billion, the lowest level since February. Initial claims for unemployment benefits rose 12,000 to 282,000.

headline.main: U.S. Trade Deficit Narrows; More File for Jobless Claims
headline.print_headline: Trade Deficit Narrows; More File as Jobless
